CMCommandQueueItem.description: a progress/status item from the async command queue

error.description: A possible error message, empty if information is set
error.example: something went wrong (empty if information is set)

information.description: An informational message, empty if error is set

version.description: The version of this service (can be empty)

JsonMessage.description: A generic SimSage message class used throughout the system.  This class can be used to either send a success message (information) or an error message (error) but will never send you both at the same time.  Version might not always be set but is the version of the service-layer you're communicating with.

prevWord.description: pagination control, the last text-to-search word we looked for previously

pageSize.description: the number of text-to-search to return at a time.

filter.description: An optional string filter to apply to all text-to-search in the search.  Can be empty in which case SimSage will return all semantics paginated.

numTextToSearch.description: the total number of text-to-search items

CMTextToSearchPaginatedReturn.description: A set of paginated text-to-search objects for a given organisation/knowledge-base with a total count.

filter.description: An optional string filter to apply to all text-to-search in the search.  Can be empty in which case SimSage will return all semantics paginated.

text.description: a return value of the try text-to-search

CMTextToSearchConversionReturn.description: A result from a text-to-search try-out.

prevId.description: pagination control, the last synonym we looked for previously

pageSize.description: the number of synonyms to return at a time.

filter.description: An optional string filter to apply to all synonyms in the search.  Can be empty in which case SimSage will return all synonyms paginated.

id.description: A unique id for this synonym, an integer

words.description: A csv list of words (per word with spaces and hyphens allowed) forming the synonyms

CMSynonym.description: the synonym object to update or create.  If it has no id, it will be created, otherwise SimSage will use it's id to find it and update it.

filter.description: The filter that was used to find these items.

numSynonyms.description: the total number of synonyms that matched.

CMSynonymsPaginatedResult.description: A paginated synonym return list matching a request for the same.

prevWord.description: pagination control, the last semantic word we looked for previously

pageSize.description: the number of semantics to return at a time.

filter.description: An optional string filter to apply to all semantics in the search.  Can be empty in which case SimSage will return all semantics paginated.

word.description: The word of a semantic is the more specific concept (eg. in 'John is a person', then 'John' is the more specific concept, and 'person' is the semantic).

semantic.description: The semantic is the more general concept (eg. in 'John is a person', 'person' is the more general concept, and 'John' is more specific).

CMSemantic.description: A SimSAge semantic.  A semantic is an 'is-a' relationship.  A generalization/specialization relationship.  The 'word' (the more specialized part) is the primary-key/id of this relationship.

filter.description: The filter that was used to find these items.

numSemantics.description: the total number of semantics that matched.

CMSemanticsPaginatedResult.description: A paginated semantics return list matching a request for the same.

word.description: the word that makes a synset group (an ambiguous noun language concept) (eg. 'bank')

lemma.description: the lemma of this word (ie. the simplified base, usually the same as the word, but the lemma of 'banks' is 'bank')

wordCloudCsvList.description: A list of word-clouds that form each distinct synset.  Each string in this variable is itself a csv string.  The first word of this cloud forms the distinct marker of the synset.

CMSynSet.description: A SynSet is an ambiguous noun.  A SynSet tells SimSage how to distinguish between different homoglyphs (same word) with different meanings.

word.description: The word of a semantic is the more specific concept (eg. in 'John is a person', then 'John' is the more specific concept, and 'person' is the semantic).

prevWord.description: The previous value for 'word' if this is a semantic changing its word value (update)

semantic.description: The semantic is the more general concept (eg. in 'John is a person', 'person' is the more general concept, and 'John' is more specific).

optimizeAllIndexes.description: Whether to optimize just the deltas (false) or the full set (true).

page.description: pagination control, the page to get (starting at zero (0))

pageSize.description: The number of results to return maximum

totalSize.description: the number of total SynSet items in your query

CMSynSetList.description: A list of SynSets for returning from SimSage for viewing.

categorizationLabel.description: the categorization label (the value field) for a categorization

rule.description: the SimSage SuperSearch rule to match for adding this categorization label to a document

name.description: the name of this knowledge-base (must be unique within an organisation)

email.description: the support email of the person to email with any UI generated questions

securityId.description: the security id (a guid) of this knowledge-base.  This is a shared secret between SimSage and external systems.

created.description: when this knowledge-base was created, a unix date-time long

maxQueriesPerDay.description: limit the number of queries per day (if greater than 0).  A value of zero (0) indicates no limits.

analyticsWindowInMonths.description: How long to keep analytics for in months.  A value of zero (0) indicates forever

enabled.description: a flag signalling this knowledge-base is active (can be used).  An inactive knowledge-base cannot be queried.

operatorEnabled.description: a flag signalling this knowledge-base has operator support.  A value of false prevents this knowledge-base's operator from interacting with end-users.

capacityWarnings.description: All queries are given a 10% grace when daily-limits (maxQueriesPerDay) are enforced.  If this flag is true, the owner of this knowledge-base (email) is sent a warning at 100% daily utiliziation.

indexSchedule.description: the time-schedule for index-optimization, when active.
indexSchedule.example: eg. If we want to optimize the indexes every Monday from midnight to 1am, and Tuesday 5pm (GMT), we'd use: "mon-00,tue-17"

lastIndexOptimizationTime.description: the last time this triggered and ran as a unix date-time (read only)

CMKnowledgeBase.description: A knowledge-base is SimSage's representation of a list of information silos belonging to an organisation.  A knowledge-base represents a second level of isolation between data in SimSage.  The first level is an Organisation.  Each organisation in SimSage has a list of knowledge-bases, strictly isolated from each other.  Each knowledge-base in turn can have many sources (information collectors that add items to a knowledge-base like a file-crawler, or a web-crawler)

organisationId.description: the organisation (its guid id) this document is to be deleted for.

kbId.description: the knowledge-base (its guid id) this document is to be deleted for.

sid.description: the security-id (a guid) of the knowledge-base.  This is effectively the shared secret between SimSage and the external-crawler system.

sourceId.description: the source-id of this crawler (ie. the crawler's id) this document belongs to.

url.description: A unique URL for this document.

encrypted.description: Do we need to add transport encryption

organisationId.description: the organisation (its guid id) this group is associated with

userIdList.description: a list of user-ids (can be empty) part of this group

items.description: a list of user-ids (can be empty) part of this group

CMGroup.description: A security-group object.  Groups can contain security users and are used to group/clump users.

password.description: a password for this user (or blank if not to be changed)

roles.description: the roles to be associated with this user

operatorKBList.description: the operator-id and knowledge-base id to be associated with this user.  This user is to be an operator if set.

groupList.description: a list of groups this user is part of (can be empty)

CMUserWithExtras.description: An object used for updating a SimSage user.  This object can be used to update the user's password too.

organisationId.description: the organisation to import the users into (its guid id)

fileType.description: the upload allows SimSage programs in text format (text/plain) or spreadsheets to be uploaded.

base64Text.description: the base64 encoded comma separated values (csv).  Must be prefixed with ';base64,'

CMImportUsers.description: a CSV file with users and group memberships.

enabled.description: true if the organisation is enabled (active/operational)

autoCreateSSOUsers.description: if enabled, SSO users will auto-create their accounts

autoCreateSSODomainList.description: a list of the allowed domain postfixes for the emails (e.g. simsage.co.uk)

items.description: a list of the allowed domain postfixes for the emails (e.g. simsage.co.uk)

autoCreateSSOACLList.description: a list of the ACLs initially assigned to each new user of they need creating

items.description: a list of the ACLs initially assigned to each new user of they need creating

autoCreateSSORoleList.description: a list of the SimSage Roles initially assigned to each new user of they need creating

items.description: a list of the SimSage Roles initially assigned to each new user of they need creating

CMOrganisation.description: A SimSage organisation object.  Represents a SimSage top-level tenant, aka. an organisation.

clientId.description: the client's id (a unique guid for keeping state against clients)

url.description: The unique URL of a document.

sentenceId.description: The sentence id to start from in the document.

span.description: The surrounding span / offset size for around the sentence

url.description: The unique URL of a document.

CMShortSummaryResult.description: The result of a short summary for a given url

kbList.description: a list of knowledge-base id's (guids) to use

items.description: a list of knowledge-base id's (guids) to use

clientId.description: the client's id (a unique guid for keeping state against clients)

qnaQuery.description: should we perform a Q&A search?

query.example: most recent similar PDF files for annual reports

filter.description: a filter expression generated by the UX

numResults.description: the number of results to return for the Q&A system (recommend 1, which returns the 'best match' only)

scoreThreshold.description: A threshold for answer rejection, recommend a value of around 81.25% (0.8125).  This value is between 0.0 and 1.0.  If this value is too low, you'll get bad answers, and if this value is too high you will only get exact matches.

page.description: search engine pagination, the offset page starting at 0

pageSize.description: search engine pagination, the number of results per page

fragmentCount.description: search engine pagination, the number of sentences matching per document (aka. document-sentence fragments)

maxWordDistance.description: how far apart words are allowed to be before they stop matching.  A value of zero (0) allows any distance within the document and is akin to a document level keyword search.

sourceId.description: The id of source (an integer) to filter results for.  You can only filter on one source per knowledge-base.  Leaving this value zero (0) indicates all sources should be searched.

shardSizeList.description: Index sharding values.  These are used by the internal engine to determine the status of results across different shards in SimSage.  Leave this value alone.  It is set by SimSage.  Pass it back to SimSage as you got it if you're paginating the same query.

items.description: Index sharding values.  These are used by the internal engine to determine the status of results across different shards in SimSage.  Leave this value alone.  It is set by SimSage.  Pass it back to SimSage as you got it if you're paginating the same query.

spellingSuggest.description: should the search-engine return spelling-suggestions for items not understood?

groupSimilarDocuments.description: should the search-engine group similar documents together

sortByAge.description: should the search-engine sort results by age

useQuestionAnsweringAi.description: use ChatGPT or equivalent to answer queries

assignedOperatorId.description: A unique id for this operator's session.

operatorName.description: the name of the operator for clients

hasResult.description: is there a result/reply or not?

urlList.description: a list of reference urls associated with this answer

items.description: a list of reference urls associated with this answer

metadata.description: metadata associated with the Question/Answer pair, user defined.

qnaScore.description: how well the Q&A matcher performed a value between 0.0 and 1.0

imageList.description: A list of image urls associated with the Q&A pair

items.description: A list of image urls associated with the Q&A pair

totalDocumentCount.description: the total number of documents found (but not included necessarily)

shardSizeList.description: Index sharding values.  These are used by the internal engine to determine the status of results across different shards in SimSage.  Leave this value alone.  It is set by SimSage.  Pass it back to SimSage as you got it if you're paginating the same query.

items.description: Index sharding values.  These are used by the internal engine to determine the status of results across different shards in SimSage.  Leave this value alone.  It is set by SimSage.  Pass it back to SimSage as you got it if you're paginating the same query.

resultList.description: the actual search results, one for each item found

spellingCorrection.description: a spelling correction suggestion if appropriate and enabled.

additionalProperties.description: A descriptor of semantic categories and words with frequencies in each category

semanticSet.description: A descriptor of semantic categories and words with frequencies in each category

knowEmail.description: do we know the email address of this person?  if they've supplied it in the past this will be set to true.

categoryList.description: updated categories (if applicable) with updated counts

synSetList.description: A list of syn-sets used in the query

customRender.description: Does this source require custom render templates or use ordinary search-results?

savedSearchList.description: a list of previous searches if applicable

querySummarization.description: an optional summarization of the search results

CMClientQueryResult.description: A SimSage return search-result message for Q&A and semantic-search queries.

isChild.description: if true, this is a child relationship, otherwise a parent relationship

relatedUrl.description: the url of the related document

webUrl.description: the web-url (if set) if there is a web-link for this document

title.description: the title of the related document for display

binarySize.description: size in bytes of the related document

documentType.description: the type of the related document

created.description: The unix creation date-time of the related item

lastModified.description: The unix last-modified date-time of the related item

CMDocumentRelationship.description: A document that related to this document in some fashion (parent or child)

organisationId.description: the main organisation (its guid id) for this history item

kbId.description: the knowledge-base id of this context item, a guid-string

created.description: a unix-timestamp of the creation date-time of this record

top.description: if set, the number of records to return for viewing

CMSavedSearch.description: A saved search item for a user.

url.description: the url of the document that matched

urlId.description: the internal SimSage id for this url (unique only within a knowledge-base)

sourceId.description: the source-id of this result (ie. the source's id)

title.description: the title of this document/record (can be empty)

author.description: the author of this document/record (can be empty)

textList.description: A list of matching fragments in this document, with highlight markers.
example: The little ponies were very excited.

items.description: A list of matching fragments in this document, with highlight markers.

textIndex.description: in case of multiple matches in textList, the best match index of these items starting at zero (0)

score.description: the relative score of this match, the bigger, the better

sortDesc.description: was this document along with any others sorted ascending or descending?

qnaResult.description: is this item a Q&A result or a search result?

firstSentence.description: the id of the first sentence in this result

created.description: document creation date-time as a unix date-time

uploaded.description: document uploaded to SimSage date-time as a unix date-time

lastModified.description: document last-modified date-time as a unix date-time

documentType.description: the type of this document/record as a three or four letter file extension

numSentences.description: the total number of sentences in the body of this document

numWords.description: the total number of words and tokens (eg. '.') in the body of this document

numRelationships.description: the total number of relationships expanded from the words in this document

binarySize.description: the binary-size of the original document in bytes

textSize.description: the text-size of the original document in number of characters

fileType.description: the DROID file-type of this document/record (can be empty)

crawled.description: document crawled (ie. picked up by SimSage) date-time as a unix date-time

converted.description: document conversion (ie. turned into text by SimSage) date-time as a unix date-time

parsed.description: document parsed (ie. language analyzed by SimSage) date-time as a unix date-time

indexed.description: document indexed (ie. creation of inverted indices by SimSage) date-time as a unix date-time

previewed.description: document preview generated (ie. creation of thumb-nail images for this document by SimSage) date-time as a unix date-time

similarDocumentList.description: A list of similar documents matched by this query.

relatedList.description: A list of similar documents matched by this query.

additionalProperties.description: A set of name-values of metadata associated with this document

metadata.description: A set of name-values of metadata associated with this document

filename.description: the filename of this document in the DMS system

folderId.description: the folderId of this item in the DMS system

renderType.description: how should this item be rendered? (default "rt search")

CMSearchResult.description: A single search result from the Semantic Search engine.  This presents a hit inside a SimSage document.

url.description: the url of the document that is similar

urlId.description: the url-id of the document that is similar

CMSimilarDocument.description: A document that is similar to another document.

CMWordFrequency.description: A word or piece of text with a frequency counter.

url.description: The unique URL of a document.

urlId.description: The unique URL-ID of a document.

conversationList.description: the context of the conversation thusfar

answer.description: The answer for the given question

CMDocumentQuestionAndAnswer.description: A basic document question/answer pair for AI

sourceId.description: the source-id of this crawler (ie. the crawler's id)

url.description: the url of the document to summarize

top.description: the top-n sentences to return for the summary of the documents

url.description: the url this text came from

summary.description: the list of summary items for the given document

items.description: the list of summary items for the given document

query.description: the query to use for a query

maximumNumberOfDocuments.description: the maximum number of documents to consider in a summarization event

url.description: the url this text came from

score.description: the score relative to the others of this sentence

CMDParagraphSummary.description: A multiple document summarization result.  Multi Document Summarization (MSD) uses SimSage's graph to create relevant extracts of series of documents matching a specific query.

message.description: a possible return message if not empty

CMQueryFocussedSummarization.description: A document summarization result (Multi Document Summarization)

urlId.description: the url Id of the document

url.description: The unique URL of this document.

page.description: the page of this document get, starting at 1

html.description: the HTML of the document returned

width.description: the display width of the HMTL document

height.description: the display height of the HMTL document

numPages.description: the total number of pages in this document

CMGetHtml.description: get an HTML preview of a document by page

url.description: A unique URL for this document.

urlId.description: A unique URL-id for this document.

origin.description: Where the document was sourced from (for external documents).

title.description: The title of this document, can be empty.

author.description: The author of this document, can be empty.

documentType.description: The file extension of this document, its type.

created.description: a unix-timestamp for the creation date-time of this document

uploaded.description: a unix-timestamp for the upload date-time of this document to SimSage

lastModified.description: a unix-timestamp for the last-modified date-time of this document

crawled.description: a unix-timestamp for when a SimSage crawler last looked at this document

converted.description: a unix-timestamp for when a SimSage converter last looked at this document

parsed.description: a unix-timestamp for when a SimSage parser last looked at this document

indexed.description: a unix-timestamp for when a SimSage indexer last looked at this document

previewed.description: a unix-timestamp for when a SimSage image-converter last looked at this document

changeHash.description: A unique hash-string identifying SimSage changes to this document.  SimSage uses the value to see if the content has changed since last.

contentHash.description: A unique hash-string identifying the content of this document.  SimSage uses this value to find exact duplicates.

sourceId.description: the source-id of this crawler (ie. the crawler's id)

parentUrl.description: a related url if there is parentage to be considered for an item

acls.description: a list of the exact ACLs applying to this document (can be empty)

additionalProperties.description: a series of name values for other metadata values found in the container of this document

metadata.description: a series of name values for other metadata values found in the container of this document

numSentences.description: the number of sentences in this document.

numWords.description: the total number of words in this document.

numRelationships.description: the total number of relationships in this document.

binarySize.description: the size of the original document's binary in bytes.

textSize.description: the size of the converted document's text in bytes.

versionList.description: list of binary versions of this document

noteList.description: list of checkout notes about this document

activityList.description: list of activities for the last two months of this document

typeDescription.description: a description of the type of this document

filename.description: the filename of this document in the DMS system

folderId.description: the folderId of this item in the DMS system

CMDocument.description: A document is the main data carrying entity in SimSage.  A document can literally be a document like a pdf file found on a file-server, or a database-record, or something captured from a remote system like a web-page, or an image on a web-page.

acl.description: Some acl value, can represent a user's email address or the name of a remote security-group.

access.description: is this ACL allowing access (Read/Write/Delete/Modify (RWDM)) or denying access (empty)

isUser.description: "true" if this a security-user (email address), "false" if this ACL pertains to a security-group (group name)

CMDocumentAcl.description: A document Access Control List (ACL) item.  This item represents a user's/group's access to a document (hasAccess or not).

organisationId.description: the main organisation (its guid id) for this source/crawler

kbId.description: the knowledge-base id of this context item, a guid-string

url.description: The unique URL of a document.

email.description: the email address of the user for this audit record

description.description: The description of the audit event

created.description: a unix-timestamp of the creation date-time of this record

CMDocumentAudit.description: An audit record for a document.

sourceId.description: the source-id of the owner of this folder

url.description: The unique URL of a document or folder.

parentFolderId.description: The id of the parent folder of this folder.

urlId.description: the internal SimSage id for this url

folderName.description: the display name of the folder

itemType.description: the type of folder (crawlerType for sources)

folderList.description: the folder items in this folder

acls.description: the security permissions for this item

organisationId.description: the main organisation (its guid id) for this source/crawler

kbId.description: the knowledge-base id of this context item, a guid-string

url.description: The unique URL of a document.

noteId.description: The id of the note, starting at 1 note of 0 means create a new note

email.description: the email address of the user that made the change

created.description: a unix-timestamp of the creation date-time of this record

CMDocumentNote.description: A note attached to a document.

url.description: The unique URL of this document.

changeHash.description: A unique hash-string identifying SimSage level changes of this document.

created.description: a unix-timestamp for the creation of this document version

CMDocumentVersion.description: A version object description for a binary-document.

organisationId.description: the main organisation (its guid id) for this source/crawler

kbId.description: the knowledge-base id of this context item, a guid-string

sourceId.description: the source-id of the owner of the url

parentId.description: The parent of a folder or a file (a guid or an empty string for a top-level folder)

objectId.description: Either a file or a folder ID

url.description: The unique URL of a document.

urlId.description: the internal SimSage id for this url

name.description: The name of the folder or file

isFolder.description: is this a subscription to a folder or a file?

CMSubscriptions.description: A set of items subscribed to.

organisationId.description: the main organisation (its guid id) for this source/crawler

kbId.description: the knowledge-base id of this context item, a guid-string

acls.description: the initial ACLs for this source-folder.

url.description: The unique URL of a document.

urlId.description: the internal SimSage id for this url

sourceId.description: the source-id of the owner of the url

name.description: the name of the checkout folder/file object

checkoutDate.description: a unix-timestamp for the creation of this checkout object

organisationId.description: the main organisation (its guid id) for this source/crawler

kbId.description: the knowledge-base id of this context item, a guid-string

url.description: The unique URL of a document.

hashTagList.description: a list of hash-tags for this document

items.description: a list of hash-tags for this document

CMDocumentHashTag.description: the document hash-tag object.  A list of hash-tags.  Each hash-tag must start with a '#' and only contain a..z,A..Z.  Minimum size 3 characters, maximum size 50 characters.

organisationId.description: the main organisation (its guid id) for this source/crawler

kbId.description: the knowledge-base id of this context item, a guid-string

sourceId.description: the source-id of the owner of the url

prevUrl.description: pagination, the previous last URL for the page-set (null is first page)

organisationId.description: the main organisation (its guid id) for this source/crawler

kbId.description: the knowledge-base id of this context item, a guid-string

sourceId.description: the source-id of the owner of the url

url.description: The unique URL of a document.

urlId.description: the internal SimSage id for this url

isFolder.description: is this a bookmark to a folder or a file?

CMDocumentBookmark.description: A bookmark to a document or folder.

organisationId.description: the main organisation (its guid id) for this source/crawler

kbId.description: the knowledge-base id of this context item, a guid-string

sourceId.description: the source-id of the owner of the url

parentId.description: the parent id of the update to update

objectId.description: the id of the update to update

itemType.description: the type of item to update, one of source, file or folder

acls.description: the initial ACLs for this source-folder.

applyToChildren.description: apply these ACLs to any children of this object?

sourceId.description: the source-id of this crawler (ie. the crawler's id)

urlList.description: an optional list of URLs (comma separated)

CMStartCrawler.description: the source id and org/kb to process.

sourceId.description: the source-id, primary key of the source

organisationId.description: the main organisation (its guid id) for this source/crawler

kbId.description: the knowledge-base id (its guid id) for this source/crawler

nodeId.description: the system's node id of this source (what kubernetes-node to run on, starting with zero, set NODE_ID in env to manipulate this value).  Sources will only run on machines with a matching node-id

name.description: the display-name (descriptive name) of this source.  The source's name must be unique within a knowledge-base.

schedule.description: the time-schedule of this crawler, when active and when not repeating in a weekly-per hour cycle in GMT time.  Empty string means not active at all
schedule.example: eg. If we want this crawler to be active every Monday from midnight to 1am, and Tuesday from 5pm to 6pm (GMT), we'd use: "mon-00,tue-17"

deleteFiles.description: Should this crawler remove files that are no longer visible after a crawl completes without errors?  Used for sources that cannot report on file/data removal.

allowAnonymous.description: Is the content of this crawler accessible anonymously (ie. no permissions/ACLs required).  Some crawlers like the web crawler always have this value as true.  NB.  Setting this flag to "true" will bypass any security on the source's own ACLs and make all its content available to everyone.

processingLevel.description: How much processing should SimSage give each file of this source.  As defined internally in ProcessingLevel.  level 1, CONVERT: convert all document binaries to text (creates metadata text).  level 2, PARSE: NLP process the files (creates sentences and tokens for all text).  level 3, INDEX: create inverted indexes for files (creates indexes).

enablePreview.description: Generate per-document image-preview information as well as full HTML previews if set to "true".

filesPerSecond.description: Any value greater than 0.0 (can be fractional) indicates SimSage should limit how many requests it makes from the remote entity we're integrating with.

specificJson.description: A json string with specific values for this type of source.  Generated by the SimSage administrative system.

maxItems.description: Set a content limit for the maximum number of items to contain for this source.  A value of zero (0) indicates no limits.

maxBotItems.description: Set a Question and Answer content limit for the maximum number of deep-learning Q&A items this source can contain.  A value of zero (0) indicates no limits.

customRender.description: Does this source require custom render templates or use ordinary search-results?

edgeDeviceId.description: The associated Edge device for this source (or empty string if not associated with one)

qaMatchStrength.description: the default threshold for matching deep-learning vector matching results (value should be between 0.7 and 0.99)

numResults.description: the default number of search results to return from the semantic-search system

numFragments.description: the number of fragments to return per search-result from the semantic-search system.  Affects accuracy, a value of "1" will only look at the first match.  Higher values look for more matches inside a single document.  Too high a value will affect performance.  Default value "3".

numErrors.description: the number of errors from the last source-run

errorThreshold.description: the number of errors allowed before failing the source and not force-removing any files at the end of a run through an external source.

startTime.description: when the last run of this source started

endTime.description: when the last run of this source finished

acls.description: A list for overwriting security permission for a source.  Can be empty.  Use this to override security on external systems.

numCrawledDocuments.description: the number of documents seen by the crawler thus-far.

numConvertedDocuments.description: the number of documents converted by SimSage thus-far.

numParsedDocuments.description: the number of documents parsed by SimSage thus-far.

numIndexedDocuments.description: the number of documents indexed by SimSage thus-far.

numFinishedDocuments.description: the number of finished (fully processed) by SimSage thus-far.

numTotalDocuments.description: the total number of documents for this source in SimSage.

useDefaultRelationships.description: "true" if this source is to use the default (built-in) SimSage relationships.  All user-defined relationships and language-entities will be used regardless of the value of this flag.

isBusy.description: "true" if this source is currently being optimized / processed by the index-optimizer.

autoOptimize.description: Do we run the index-optimizer automatically after this source finishes crawling?

storeBinary.description: "true" if this source is to store all documents locally on the SimSage platform

versioned.description: "true" if this source is to store all versions of documents locally on the SimSage platform

writeToCassandra.description: "true" if this source is to write any changes direct to Cassandra, otherwise this source will collect indexes on disk first (for initial loading)

processorConfig.description: Json string defining any optional processors configured on the source

documentSimilarityThreshold.description: the document similarity threshold for grouping documents, a value between 0.75 and 1.0

isExternal.description: is this crawler to be connected as an external source using our external crawler software?

useOCR.description: enable OCR processing for files in this source?

useSTT.description: enable Speech-to-text processing for files in this source?

CMSource.description: A SimSage source object used for updating and creating SimSage crawlers/connections to external silos like Sharepoint, OneDrive, Exchange, DropBox, Box, iManage, and others.

objectType.description: the type of this class, just in case this object is encrypted

organisationId.description: the organisation (its guid id) this document should go into.

kbId.description: the knowledge-base (its guid id) this document should go into.

sid.description: the security-id (a guid) of the knowledge-base.  This is effectively the shared secret between SimSage and the external-crawler system.

sourceId.description: the source-id of this crawler (ie. the crawler's id) this document came from.

url.description: A unique URL for this document.

mimeType.description: The mime-type of this document, must be a known-datatype to SimSage.

puid.description: The Pronom Unique ID for this document.

acls.description: A list of security permission for this document.  Can be empty (ie. no security applied).

title.description: The title of this document, can be empty.

author.description: The author of this document, can be empty.

changeHash.description: A unique hash-string identifying the change state of this document.  This can be any hash-function you choose.  SimSage uses the value to see if the content has changed since last.

contentHash.description: A unique hash-string identifying the contents this document.  This can be any hash-function you choose.  SimSage uses this value for exact duplicate detection.

data.description: the base64 encoded content of this document.  Must be prefixed with ';base64,', can be empty indicating the content wasn't valid.

binarySize.description: the binary-size of the document in bytes if data is not set.

text.description: the text content of the asset (if set).

created.description: a unix-timestamp of the creation date-time of this document

lastModified.description: a unix-timestamp of the last-modified date-time of this document

additionalProperties.description: a series of name values for other metadata values found in the container of this document

metadata.description: a series of name values for other metadata values found in the container of this document

categories.description: A list of special SimSage metadata categories for matching this document with.  Can be empty.

size.description: The size of this document (the original) in bytes

template.description: A render template for this document.  This is only appropriate for Database and RESTful type sources.

encrypted.description: Do we need to add transport encryption

runId.description: the id (a guid) of the current 'go through the source once'.  This is a unique per-run identifier.

key.example: one of: select if true,star rating,number range,monetary x 100 range,monetary range,csv string,category,url-image,base64-image,binary-blob-image

display.description: A friendly display name for any UI component rendering this component

metadata.description: The metadata-name inside SimSage for this item.  Only a..z A..Z 0..9 and - are allowed as characters in this string.

stringValueList.description: A list of string values (if string based) for this metadata category item.  These are the values this document "belongs to"

numberValueList.description: Alternatively, a list of numeric values (if number based) for this metadata category item.  These are the values this document "belongs to"

sort.description: Is this category to be sort-able in the UI?

order.description: What order does this item have in the UI display?

sortDefault.description: Is this item THE default sort item in the UI, and if so, is it ascending (asc) or descending (desc).  Not the default sort if empty.

sortAscText.description: If sortable, what label should the UI display for ascending sort?

sortDescText.description: If sortable, what label should the UI display for descending sort?

MDCategory.description: A SimSage category is a metadata description in SimSage.  This object represents a single piece of categorical data that is uploaded to SimSage from external sources as part of a CMDocumentUpload request.

objectType.description: the type of this class, just in case this object is encrypted

organisationId.description: the organisation (its guid id) this image should go into.

kbId.description: the knowledge-base (its guid id) this image should go into.

sid.description: the security-id (a guid) of the knowledge-base.  This is effectively the shared secret between SimSage and the external-crawler system.

sourceId.description: the source-id of this crawler (ie. the crawler's id) this image came from.

url.description: A unique URL for this image, this should be the same as the document's URL this image belongs to.

mimeType.description: The mime-type of this image, must be either image/jpeg or image/png.

puid.description: The Pronom Unique ID for this image.

data.description: the base64 encoded content of this image.  Must be prefixed with ';base64,'.

encrypted.description: Do we need to add transport encryption

kbId.description: the knowledge-base (its guid id) this document should go into.

sid.description: the security-id (a guid) of the knowledge-base.  This is effectively the shared secret between SimSage and the external-crawler system.

sourceId.description: the source-id of this crawler (ie. the crawler's id) this document came from.

url.description: A unique URL for this document.

runId.description: the id (a guid) of the current 'go through the source once'.  This is a unique per-run identifier.

sourceId.description: the source-id of this crawler (ie. the crawler's id)

organisationId.description: the main organisation (its guid id) for this source/crawler

sourceId.description: the source-id of this crawler (ie. the crawler's id)

numErrors.description: the number of errors encountered during the run of this crawler

runId.description: the id (a guid) of the current 'go through the source once'.  This is a unique per-run identifier.

base64Text.description: the base64 text to restore from.

fileType.description: the file-type of the base64 text (must be text/plain)

CMRestoreFromText.description: an object with the text to restore from

email.description: email address of the user logging in

userId.description: the user's id (its guid id) that is an operator

organisationId.description: the organisation (its guid id) this operator applies to

kbId.description: the knowledge-base (its guid id) this operator applies to

CMOperatorKnowledgeBase.description: An association between a user (with an operator role) and a knowledge-base

userId.description: the user associated with this session, their id, a guid

organisationId.description: the main organisation (its guid id) this session is associated with if applicable (administrators do not have such an association)

ipAddress.description: the ip-address of the user logging in if captured

lastAccess.description: a unix-timestamp of the last time this session was accessed/refreshed

role.description: the main/highest role of the user signed-in

sessionType.description: the type of sign-in (Anonymous (i.e. valid but search only) or SimSage)

CMSession.description: A session object, A session's id is the "session-id" used throughout the SimSage API.

organisationList.description: list of organisations for admin users

CMSessionVersion.description: A SimSage combined session / user and version object.  This is the object returned when you've signed-in successfully.

email.description: email address of this user (their sign-in and primary identity)

roles.description: a list of SimSage roles associated with this user

operatorKBList.description: a list of knowledge-bases this user is an operator for

groupList.description: a list of security-groups this user is part of (can be empty)

CMUser.description: A SimSage user object for editing and reviewing.

organisationId.description: the organisation (its guid id) this role applies to

role.description: the SimSage role inside this organisation

CMUserRole.description: A user's SimSage-role inside an organisation.  SimSage roles determine what a user can do/access inside SimSage and are specific to SimSage.  Roles include admin (a SimSage administrator, super-user), manager (a SimSage manager, a user that has super-user access to one and one organisation only), operator (a SimSage operator, a user that can access the SimSage operator interface for a specific organisation), dms (a SimSage user that can sign-in to our Document Management System interface, specific to an organisation).

email.description: email address of the user wishing to reset their password.

resetId.description: the reset-id/token sent to you by SimSage via email.

password.description: the new password for this user

email.description: email address of the user wishing to reset their password.

CMVersion.description: A generic version object.  Returns the version of whatever service you're communicating with, part of the /version commands of each micro-service.

message.description: the main message of the log entry

type.description: the type of log entry (eg. Debug, Info, Warn, Error)

service.description: the name of the service that generated this log

CMLoggerEntry.description: This object represents a single system-log entry.  A list of these is returned by the CMSystemLogs structure.

accessFrequency.description: A list of 31 values, one for each day of the month indicating the number of unique access for each day of the month.

additionalProperties.description: The top list of queries (the strings) and their frequencies

queryWordFrequency.description: The top list of queries (the strings) and their frequencies

additionalProperties.description: Some more general statistics (eg. number of documents) and their frequencies

generalStatistics.description: Some more general statistics (eg. number of documents) and their frequencies

additionalProperties.description: The breakdown of file-types (by file extension) and their frequencies

fileTypeStatistics.description: The breakdown of file-types (by file extension) and their frequencies

CMReturnStatistics.description: This object is used to requests a set of specific and general statistics.  The general statistics have no time associated with them (eg. file-type frequencies).  The other statistics are month based and include system-query-access by day of the month, and query-word frequencies.

totalCategorizationCount.description: the total number of categorizations in SimSage for this org/kb

kbList.description: the list of knowledge-base information items that belong to the given organisation.

CMInfo.description: An Info record contains information for external UI systems wishing to interact with SimSage.  This information is for a single-organisation and contains all the knowledge-bases and their information for this organisation.

categoryList.description: a list of metadata-categories present in this source, names and values.

sourceList.description: the list of sources that are in this knowledge-base

CMKnowledgeBaseInfo.description: Knowledge base-info represents information needed by external UX systems interacting with SimSage.  This object contains information of a SimSage knowledge-base.  The name, and id of, and sources inside this knowledge-base.

sourceId.description: the id of this source

customRender.description: Does this source require custom render templates or use ordinary search-results?

domainType.description: the domain security type (if applicable) of this source (can be empty).  Types: 'ad' classical Microsoft Active Directory, 'aad' Azure Active Directory, 'simsage' SimSage platform user accounts

clientId.description: a Microsoft client-id for Azure Domain access

redirectUrl.description: a Microsoft redirect-url for Azure Domain access

CMSourceBaseInfo.description: Source base-info represents information needed by external UI systems interacting with SimSage.  This object has information pertaining to a source in SimSage.  Its name, id, what sort of a source it is, and what sort of security integration (if any) this source has.  This object is contained inside a CMKnowledgeBaseInfo object.

documentType.description: The file extension of a document, its type.

count.description: The count of this type in SimSage.

CMDocumentTypeFrequency.description: An entity for holding document type and a count for that type.

time.description: a unix-time for this parquet item

CMParquetItem.description: A single parquet item, a name with a timestamp.

timeList.description: a list of unix-times for parquet items in the system

totalCount.description: the total (non paged) amount of items available

CMParquetTimeList.description: This object is used to return a set of time-stamps (unix date-time items) related to the catalogue of inventory items inside SimSage for a given organisation/knowledge-base.  Each time-stamp represents a snapshot taken of the knowledge-base at a time by the user.

url.description: The unique URL of a folder.

sourceId.description: the source-id of the owner of this folder

isFolder.description: is this a notification for a folder or a file?

userId.description: the user to be notified, a guid

whoId.description: the user that made the change, a guid

email.description: the email address of the user that made the change

created.description: a unix-timestamp of the creation date-time of this record

CMUserNotification.description: A notification to a user from a subscription.

lockList.description: list of locked documents for this user

bookmarkList.description: list of bookmarks for this user

notificationList.description: list of DMS notifications for this user

savedSearchList.description: list of saved searches for this user

CMUserList.description: A paginated/filtered list of users with a total user count.

userList.description: the list of users for all groups

CMGroupList.description: A security-group list.  A list of groups for security purposes.
